articles.summary: There are concerns that 40 per cent of the snow leopard's habitat in Nepal would be lost due to climate change. Conservationists urge COP30 to recognise wildlife as the heartbeat of global climate.    .   for more information, go to: http://www.council30.org/news/index.html

articles.title: Chile's endangered Humboldt penguins risk further decline, scientists say
articles.author: Straits Times
articles.summary: Competition for food due to commercial fishing and climate change are among the reasons why people are living on less food.    .   ...   "Climate change" is one of the main reasons why. "Commercial fishing" and "climate change" are other reasons.

articles.title: UK scientists contribute to global UNESCO report warning of unprecedented glacier loss (BAS - British Antarctic Survey)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: A scientist from the British Antarctic Survey has contributed to a major international publication. The publication highlights the accelerating decline of glaciers and ice sheets and their consequences for people and the planet. It is coordinated by the UK National Commission for UNESCO and is published by the National Commission.

articles.title: Key 'fingerprint' reveals slowdown of Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: The Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) is an ocean current system that transports heat from the tropics to the North Atlantic. AMOC is responsible for the Atlantic Ocean heat transport system.   It is a circulation system that travels from the Tropics to North Atlantic Ocean.

articles.title: A Lifetime of Feathers: One Man's Backyard Reveals the Startling Truth About Birds and a ...
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: A 50-year-long chronicle from a Pennsylvania oasis shows how climate change is rewriting the rules of nature, one bird at a time. Frederic Buse, a dedicated backyard naturalist, believes that one chart is worth a thousand words.

articles.title: COP30 stresses countries' need for resilience to extreme weather
articles.author: The New Arab
articles.summary: Delegates at Brazil's COP30 summit are grappling with how to help the vulnerable withstand worsening weather and other climate extremes. The topic of "adaptation" has been discussed at the COP30.   Lives, well-being and jobs cannot be sustained where homes, schools, farms, and businesses are under threat from flooding, drought, or climate extremes, according to the conference.

articles.title: Cane toads are hopping towards the Pilbara, but a water-free containment zone could stop them
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: The northern quoll is stalking its prey in the early evening in Australia's top end. It is early evening and the quoll follows its prey keenly. It's a hunting season in the top end of Australia's north.    .

articles.title: Data on weather systems keeping Ireland unusually mild at risk over US funding gap
articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: Data critical for tracking weather systems affecting Ireland is missing and the body tasked with gathering it is facing a funding crisis, the Cop30 climate summit heard. The Global Climate Observing System warned that the loss of the US as a key funder was putting its work in jeopardy.

articles.title: The climate conundrum: Cleaner air may be accelerating global warming by reducing cloud reflectivity
articles.author: Natural News
articles.summary: Cleaner air reduces harmful aerosols that make clouds reflective, inadvertently accelerating global warming by decreasing cloud cover and allowing more light into the atmosphere.    .   "CleanerAir.org" is a website dedicated to promoting clean air and promoting global warming.

articles.title: A Freeze Warning is expected in Jacksonville Tuesday night. Here's how long it will last
articles.author: jacksonville.com
articles.summary: Lake-effect snow blankets states around the Great Lakes. Frigid polar winds from Canada are bringing an early winter to Florida with temperatures 20-25 degrees below average. Florida's air is coming from the Arctic near the North Pole, which is why it's about to get cold.

articles.title: Earth blasted by largest solar flare of 2025 triggering potential blackouts TODAY
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: The sun has sent a wave of solar activity that could affect Earth starting on Tuesday. A powerful X5.1-class flare capable of disrupting satellites, high-frequency radio and high-altitude flights burst from the sun today. The flare caused a radio disruption.

articles.title: Record-low temperatures shock the Southeast US while snowfall blankets parts of the Northeast
articles.author: HANNAH FINGERHUT
articles.summary: 18 million people are affected by a freeze warning across Alabama, Florida and Georgia. The cold spell moved from the Northern Plains and has plunged the southeastern U.S. into record-low temperatures. The freeze warning affects 18 million people in Alabama, Georgia and Florida.
